name: Federal laboratory technology transfer activity indicators, by selected agencies: FYs 2006, 2009, 2012, and 2016
description: Federal laboratory technology transfer activity indicators, by selected agencies: FYs 2006, 2009, 2012, and 2016

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

specialValues.D: suppressed to avoid disclosure of confidential information

notes: The table includes seven federal departments and agencies that reported R&D obligations at or above $1 billion in FY 2014. (The National Science Foundation was also in this group, but its corresponding data were not available.) Other federal agencies not listed but included in the All federal laboratories totals are the Department of the Interior, the Department of Transportation, the Department of Veterans Affairs, and the Environmental Protection Agency. Invention licenses refer to inventions that are patented or could be patented. CRADAs refers to all agreements executed under CRADA authority (15 U.S.C. 3710a). Traditional CRADAs are collaborative R&D partnerships between a federal laboratory and one or more nonfederal organizations. Federal agencies have varying authorities for other kinds of collaborative R&D relationships.
sources: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), U.S. Department of Commerce, Federal Laboratory Technology Transfer, Fiscal Year 2016: Summary Report to the President and the Congress (2019), Federal Laboratory Technology Transfer, Fiscal Year 2013. Summary Report to the President and the Congress (2015), and Federal Laboratory Technology Transfer, Fiscal Year 2010. Summary Report to the President and the Congress (2012); National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), U.S. Department of Commerce, Federal Lab Technology Transfer Database v.2015. Accessed 10 January 2020.
